tool.name: qiime2 alignment mafft-add
tool.description: Add sequences to multiple sequence alignment with MAFFT.

param.name: alignment
param.label: alignment: FeatureData[AlignedSequence]
param.help: [required] The alignment to which sequences should be added.

param.name: parttree
param.label: parttree: Bool
param.help: [default: No] This flag is required if the number of sequences being aligned are larger than 1000000. Disabled by default

param.name: addfragments
param.label: addfragments: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Optimize for the addition of short sequence fragments (for example, primer or amplicon sequences). If not set, default sequence addition is used.

param.name: keeplength
param.label: keeplength: Bool
param.help: [default: No] If selected, the alignment length will be unchanged. Any added sequence that would otherwise introduce new insertions into the alignment, will have those insertions deleted, to preserve original alignment length.

param.name: large
param.label: large: Bool
param.help: [default: No] This flag is required when aligning very large datasets that do not otherwise fit into memory. Temporary data is then stored in files, instead of RAM. The --use-cache flag specifies the storage location of the temporary files created. By default, $TMP/qiime2/ is used.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: alignment mafft-add ============================ Add sequences to multiple sequence alignment with MAFFT.
Outputs: -------- :expanded_alignment.qza: Alignment containing the provided aligned and unaligned sequences.
|
Description: ------------ Add new sequences to an existing alignment with MAFFT.
|
